description: Coding theory is useful in networking, programming, system development, and other areas where computers communicate with each other.
Game theory is useful in artificial intelligence and cybernetics.

Discrete mathematics covers the mathematics of discrete events; i.e., events that involve distinct elements, finite structures of distinct elements or finite sampled versions of continuous phenomena (such as movement).
keywords: Discrete; discrete mathematics; graphs; logic; proofs

description: The study of graphs; Provides foundations for data structures and searching algorithms.
The study of logic within mathematics.
Theory of the integers. Used in cryptography as well as a test domain in artificial intelligence.
Sequential and parallel computational procedures for solving a wide range of problems.
The organization and manipulation of data.
keywords: Data; Manipulation of data; Data structures

description: The implementation and study of systems that exhibit an autonomous intelligence or behavior of their own.
keywords: Artificial Intelligence; AI; Machine learning; autonomous intelligence

description: Solving engines, such as used in Prolog, which produce steps to a result given a query on a fact and rule database, and automated theorem provers that aim to prove mathematical theorems with some assistance from a programmer.
keywords: Prolog; Automated reasoning; Artificial Intelligence; AI

description: Algorithms for identifying three-dimensional objects from a two-dimensional picture.
keywords: Artificial intelligence; AI; Computer graphics; Computer visualization; Two-dimensional; Three-dimensional; 2D; 3D

description: The use of inexact solutions for otherwise extremely difficult problems
Building systems and algorithms that analyze, understand, and generate natural (human) languages.
keywords: Natural language processing; languages; Human-computer interaction

description: Algorithms for controlling the behaviour of robots.
Algorithms and protocols for reliably communicating data across different shared or dedicated media, often including error correction.
keywords: Communication; Communicating data; shared data; dedicated media; Networks

description: Practical aspects of securing computer systems and computer networks.
keywords: Computer systems; Computer networks; Computer security; Cybersecurity

description: Applies results from complexity, probability, algebra and number theory to invent and break codes, and analyze the security of cryptographic protocols.
The design, organization, optimization and verification of a computer system, mostly about CPUs and Memory subsystem (and the bus connecting them).
keywords: Computer architecture; Compute organization; CPU; Memory; Hardware

description: Systems for managing computer programs and providing the basis of a usable system.
keywords: Operating system; OS; Managing computer programs

description: Algorithms both for generating visual images synthetically, and for integrating or altering visual and spatial information sampled from the real world.
keywords: Computer graphics; image generation; visual and spatial information

description: Determining information from an image through computation.
keywords: Image processing; Computer graphics; Image computation

description: Methods for representing and displaying abstract data to facilitate human interaction for exploration and understanding.
keywords: Information visualization; image processing; abstract data

description: The theory and practice of simultaneous computation; data safety in any multitasking or multithreaded environment.
keywords: Parallel computing; parallel processing; simultaneous computation; multithreaded environment; threads

description: Computing using multiple concurrent threads of execution, devising algorithms for solving problems on multiple processors to achieve maximal speed-up compared to sequential execution
keywords: Parallel computing; parallel processing; simultaneous computation; multithreaded environment; threads; Concurrency; multiprocessing

description: Computing using multiple computing devices over a network to accomplish a common objective or task and thereby reducing the latency involved in single processor contributions for any task.
The set theoretic and algorithmic foundation of databases.
keywords: Relational databases; SQL; Set theory; databases

description: Non-relational databases such as NoSQL databases.
Study of algorithms for searching and processing information in documents and databases; closely related to information retrieval.
Theory of compiler design, based on Automata theory.
Taxonomy of programming languages, their strength and weaknesses. Various programming paradigms, such as object-oriented programming.
keywords: Programming languages; Programming paradigms; Object-oriented programming

description: The design, implementation, analysis, characterization, and classification of formal languages known as programming languages.
rigorous mathematical study of the meaning of programs.
Formal analysis of the types of data, and the use of these types to understand properties of programs — especially program safety.
Constructing mathematical models and quantitative analysis techniques and using computers to analyze and solve scientific problems.
keywords: Mathematical models; quantitative analysis; Computational science

description: Approximate numerical solution of mathematical problems such as root-finding, integration, the solution of ordinary differential equations; the approximation of special functions.
Manipulation and solution of expressions in symbolic form, also known as Computer algebra.
Numerical simulations of large non-analytic systems
Computational modelling of theoretical chemistry in order to determine chemical structures and properties
The use of computer science to maintain, analyse, store biological data and to assist in solving biological problems such as Protein folding, function prediction and Phylogeny.
Computational modelling of neurophysiology.
Mathematical approaches for describing and reasoning about software design.
The principles and practice of designing, developing, and testing programs, as well as proper engineering practices.
keywords: Software design; engineering practices; software engineering; software development; testing

description: Using ideas from algorithm theory to creatively design solutions to real tasks.
The practice of using a programming language to implement algorithms.

description: The study and design of computer interfaces that people use.
keywords: Human-computer interaction; User experience design; UX design; UI; User interaction

description: The application of the scientific method to the understanding of arbitrary existing software.
Different logical structures for solving problems.
What is calculable with the current models of computers. Proofs developed by Alan Turing and others provide insight into the possibilities of what may be computed and what may not.
Fundamental bounds (especially time and storage space) on classes of computations.
keywords: Computational complexity; Big O; Time complexity; Space complexity

description: Explores computational models involving quantum superposition of bits.
